title: LLMs-based Few-Shot Disease Predictions using EHR: A Novel Approach Combining Predictive Agent Reasoning and Critical Agent Instruction
abstract: arXiv:2403.15464v1 Announce Type: cross  Abstract: Electronic health records (EHRs) contain valuable patient data for health-related prediction tasks, such as disease prediction. Traditional approaches rely on supervised learning methods that require large labeled datasets, which can be expensive and challenging to obtain. In this study, we investigate the feasibility of applying Large Language Models (LLMs) to convert structured patient visit data (e.g., diagnoses, labs, prescriptions) into natural language narratives. We evaluate the zero-shot and few-shot performance of LLMs using various EHR-prediction-oriented prompting strategies. Furthermore, we propose a novel approach that utilizes LLM agents with different roles: a predictor agent that makes predictions and generates reasoning processes and a critic agent that analyzes incorrect predictions and provides guidance for improving the reasoning of the predictor agent. tldr: 该论文提出了一种新方法，结合预测性代理推理和批判性代理指导，利用LLMs对结构化患者就诊数据进行预测，取得了较好的效果。
en_tdlr: This paper presents a novel approach that combines predictive agent reasoning and critical agent instruction, using LLMs to predict structured patient visit data, showing promising results.
